metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2571 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.0101.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2571` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> in versions prior than focal, the suspected code can be found in src/edit.c. A more careful analysis would be needed to determine if those versions are vulnerable.

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.5').
